body.p: This section explains how to work with patches in .

section.title: What is a Patch
section.p: Suppose you are working to a set of XML files that you distribute to other people and from time to time you tag the project and distribute the releases. If you continue working while correcting problems, you may find yourself in the situations where you need to notify your users that you have corrected a problem. In this case you may prefer to distribute a patch, which is a collection of differences, that applied over the last distribution, would correct the problem. The SVN client creates the patch in the Unified Diff format.
Creating a patch in implies the access to either two revisions of a versioned item, or two different versioned items from the repository:

ul.li: Two revisions of a version item - the item can be local or remote and you can select two versions of it. This also applies when you need to generate a patch that only contains the changes in the working copy that were not yet committed.
Two different versioned items from the repository - the items are remote and you need to specify a revision for both.
